website_summaries.verdict: Brother certainly makes a lot of very respectable work-friendly all-in-one printers, but the J885DW isn't one of them.
pros: The ink cartridges on the Brother MFC-J885DW cost less to refill than other name-brand printers and the output quality is also commendable down to small fonts and faint lines
cons: The plastic materials cheapen the overall feel of the printer, the 100-sheet paper input capacity will likely be too small for the average small office, and the output speed is lacking compared to the competition

customer_reviews.title: Had to replace a unit because message about ink low
customer_reviews.text: This unit is actually a replacement for an almost identical model that has been failing with messages about being out of ink, even though there is plenty of ink in the genuine Brother cartridges. At one point the earlier printer wouldn't print at all, but it is printing normally now despite the warning messages. I bought this printer as a backup because it appears Brother is discontinuing all the printers that use those particular ink cartridges. The earlier printer worked fine attached to a Windows laptop via USB and also connected over the Google cloud for use by a Chromebook. That all works fine and was pretty easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Pumps74

customer_reviews.title: The Best Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This Brother Printer provides all the requirements I need, scans, copies, faxes, & just plain prints. It is pretty fast, the quality is great for and ink jet printer. Best of all, the ink cartridges are the cheapest I have found. These generic cartridges have worked very well for me on my previous Brother printer which I had for about 9 years, but finally decided just to go with and updated printer. Installation was super easy and it connects wirelessly quickly to my WiFi router & ISP. In order to receive the free shipping I had to wait about two weeks but it was well worth the wait. I highly recommend this printer and Brother's online support.
customer_reviews.author: Rockyx25

customer_reviews.title: Excellent basic product
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, excellent price, fast shipping! For a basic printer, copier, scanner, the Brother Inkjet is very good and won't bust your budget.
customer_reviews.author: Kim D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, and an even greater install process.
customer_reviews.text: The setup was easy. I did not have any issues getting my phone connected to the printer. All I had to do was download the “iPrint&Scan” App from the App Store. The printer has worked great so far. The ink was very easy to install... it was actually the easiest install I’ve ever had. I’m so glad that I am able to print web articles, pictures, emails, and notes all from my mobile device. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Kay

customer_reviews.title: Plastic. Not Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Slow, cheap feeling & buggy. Every day was new error message. I tolerated it for a week and sent it back. I've used Brother printers before and they've always been good. Not this time.
customer_reviews.author: Don Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I fully appreciate the two-sided printing, wi-fi and other features. Very happy I upgraded to get it. The concern I have is the that Brother company wants to make it difficult to by-pass using their ink. Buyers have the right to use any ink they decide to use.
customer_reviews.author: PeterCW

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this machine but I do use it. The finish is rather cheap and plastic. It does all functions but is slow especially on double sided printing. Despite how I feel about this machine, my guess is that none of today's machines are quality built to last and the more features, the more goes wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Annimosity

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few printers I have found that will print on card stock with individual color tanks.
customer_reviews.author: TheGnostic

customer_reviews.title: IN MY OPINION- DO NOT USE THIS SELLER
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd of this style. I really like the first one but this one is a lemon. I've been on the phone hours with Brother prior to needing to return it. Now the seller is ignoring me. IN MY OPINION - DO NOT USE THIS SELLER!
customer_reviews.author: mzmary

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have owned HP and Lexmark Printers and this is by far the best one I've owned. Would highly recommend it to all
customer_reviews.author: Randy G

customer_reviews.title: It's a superb printer but the cable that the company ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a superb printer but the cable that the company provides dose not work. I had to buy a separate one which is completely different then this.
customer_reviews.author: Noopur

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Pictures look professional and the ink is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: David M Grippe

customer_reviews.title: but works fine. It connected easily to my network and the ...
customer_reviews.text: A little slow in printing, but works fine. It connected easily to my network and the quaity of print is very good.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product and prices and great service, and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: 2 sided printing. Don't get confused setting up the printer. It is not like the ones from 10 years ago
customer_reviews.text: 2 sided printing to save trees. All you need to do is connect to your Wi-Fi network using the printer prompt. And all computers connected to that Wi-Fi, even the main computer, will have access to the printer. Minus one star since it is a must to be connected to the Wi-Fi to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good all-in one
customer_reviews.text: Good all-in one, compact printer for desktop. Copies are good, but not real fast. Still, I would recommend it for home office or private office for small printing jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Terry P. Abeyta

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer! Easy to set up and works will with mobile phones and ipads to print wirelessly with minimal steps. I like that it stays in sleep mode and can print wirelessly without having to go and turn it on before printing.
customer_reviews.author: G-Money

customer_reviews.title: Declining product quality
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as previous Brother printers. It looks like they have regressive engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony  Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: I have had no problems with this new machine and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems with this new machine and I think it was a bargain for the price it went for
customer_reviews.author: david booker

customer_reviews.title: Better for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up once drivers were loaded on PC. Even easier on iPad. Prints very good for an inkjet. But very slow. Overall excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie Guttenberg

customer_reviews.title: BROTHER SAYS IF SHIPPED FROM ANOTHER COUNTRY TO U. ...
customer_reviews.text: BROTHER SAYS IF SHIPPED FROM ANOTHER COUNTRY TO U.S. THERE IS NO WARRANTY IN THE U.S. HOPE I HAVE NO PROBLEMS.
customer_reviews.author: carol f reed

customer_reviews.title: OK for light home use, nothing special
customer_reviews.text: Purchased elsewhere about 1 year ago. Print quality is fine for our light home use. Goes through ink fairly quickly even with light use. And it frequently gives "paper jam" messages even though there is no paper in front, back, or anywhere that I can find. Open all doors, slam them, and it goes again. But walk away, and next time I print I get "paper jam" ... does drive me crazy sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: and it worked fine for a few months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another printer, and it worked fine for a few months. Then it started printing really faint and uneven. I switched the ink cartridges, still didn't print well. I troubleshooted and cleaned the printer heads - twice - and it still is barely printing. And the copy feature takes FOREVER. Now on to printer number three.
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate Education

customer_reviews.title: This Brother MFC-J885DW printer lasted me about a year and ...
customer_reviews.text: This Brother MFC-J885DW printer lasted me about a year and printed for me in total probably around 100 pages, but now -- after adding new ink -- cannot print clearly (even without ink-saving on). The printouts now are faded, often with some lines partly missing. Perhaps it could be repaired, but that's almost not worth the expense. I now think of this item as the "Oh, Brother" printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Gillette

customer_reviews.title: Constant print quality problems
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great deal on a quality printer, but the nozzles clog frequently, leaving lines on printed artwork, and each cleaning of the print heads drinks a few percent of the ink cartridge. I've used as much as 50% of a cartridge trying to get the nozzles clean enough to print a usable image. I'm used to Epson printers, which seem to work perfectly right up until something major breaks. This one is just eating my time and drinking my money. Would not buy again, even at the bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Ross

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer Ever - Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a couple of years now and it's the worst printer I've ever owned. The ink cartridges say they are good for 260 pages but they were constantly running out and I don't even print very often. I would guess they only lasted for about 15-20 pages before running out. I never got the scanner to work because of some firewall issue. One day it started giving me an error and wouldn't print at all. I could never figure out how to fix it so finally ended up replacing it (with a different brand because I will never buy Brother again)!
customer_reviews.author: galxe

customer_reviews.title: Don't even think about buying this printer!
customer_reviews.text: After years of HP printer use, I decided to try this Brother Printer. This printer is garbage. The ink will run out faster than you can believe and it will cost $40 bucks to fill up the cartridges. After you replace the ink cartridges, the printer will run through a box of paper as it "receives data". If you do any printing at all, you will have to run down to the store for more ink. I hate this thing. DON'T DO IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Phil

customer_reviews.title: A printer programmed to lie
customer_reviews.text: It is really annoying when a printer is programmed to lie to you. OK, so my red cartridge is out of ink. Got it. But I'm trying to print in black and white, so it really shouldn't matter. But the stupid printer keeps telling me it 'cannot print'... and then in high faluting terms 'cannot maintain print quality'. Oh, and then the stupid error screen is impossible to get off!! Uses ink like a drunken sailor, and then won't print in just black and white!! Seriously annoying!!
customer_reviews.author: Von

customer_reviews.title: Uses Lots of Ink!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer about a year now. I use it in my home office and only use it about once a month to print occasional documents, and have probably printed less than 20 pages. I've already replaced the ink cartridges twice. For some reason it uses a lot of ink when it frequently cleans the print heads. My last printer, an HP, didn't use near this much ink. The print quality is good, but it's not worth having to use this much ink. My next printer will be another HP.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: This is a huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a huge disappointment. I like the features and the fact this is supposed to be a very economical printer. However, it is a pain to set up and it constantly sends out error messages. It prints very slowly, and I never managed to scan anything from my PC laptop nor directly form the machine to a usb flash drive. I have to juggle from different computers to get anything done.I haven't been so annoyed and frustrated by an electronic device in a very long time, Besides that, it also seems very fragile, specially the paper tray compartment. This is definitely not worth a hundred bucks. It's going back to the store where I bought it from
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: always out of ink
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for about 1-2 years . I do not use the printer very often. I don't know if the ink dries up or what but the unit will tell you it can not detect the cartridges' and needs to be replaced. The reason I am writing this review is I got the message again and the cartridges have never been used. So buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: 2B4Got10

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: piece of junk. Won't print if one color goes out.
customer_reviews.author: sfinks27

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer about a year ago and it is HORRIBLE. Ink dries up far too quickly, it's impossible to figure out how to get it to scan to any other device and instructions stink. I've spent far too many frustrating hours with this thing. No more Brother printers!
customer_reviews.author: Cookiequeen

customer_reviews.title: It does work!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a printer that works. After having Canon printers that always seemed to fail at just the wrong time, I went to the local office supply store and found a salesperson who was more than willing to help me end my frustration. This was easy to set up, doesn't take forever to print, doesn't click/clack with endless noise before printing and has a much smaller footprint. The cost was less than the price quoted here and if it keeps working as well as it has for two weeks, I'll be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Carter

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Worst!!
customer_reviews.text: The worst printer I ever have owned. I don't use it every day or week, but when I do - it never works. I have to spend 3-60 minutes waiting & talking to customer service to print one little item. Just now I was disconnected while talking to a rep and the little jerk didn't call me back, after he earlier said he had my number. I had never bought anything from this company, and I never will again. It's just junk. Now I have to buy another printer. I give up. I bought a Cannon and it works fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rob M.

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had a single problem with it, it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a single problem with it, it is fast and flawless. As a bonus I can print from anything that can print and it takes care of it.
customer_reviews.author: M Z

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a few days now, and so far I've been pretty impressed. The setup on all my devices was super easy, the print quality has been good, and the wireless feature is awesome! I love being able to print from my kitchen to the printer two rooms over! I haven't done any color printing yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fairly good with standard documents--reasonably fast and nice clean copies. And the scanning function works well. But if I try to print something of a nonstandard size (I'm thinking particularly of printing checks) it screws up about one time in two. The check comes through twisted, or it jams, or it sucks up the piece of paper underneath instead of the check.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Heiney

customer_reviews.title: Slowest printer I've ever seen Set up took a while ...
customer_reviews.text: Slowest printer I've ever seen Set up took a while and not intuitive I'll be returning this POS for a refund DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: John Cotherman

product_meta.title: Brother MFC-J885DW Work Smart Inkjet All in One
product_meta.description: Work smart inkjet all in one, MFC-J885DW is a compact & easy to connect color inkjet all-in-one it can print copy scan and fax. 2.7" touchscreen display. Convenient wireless mobile device printing via air print, Google cloud print, emporia, Brother iprint&scan Plus NFC touch to connect 2 direct printing or scanning. Print on photo paper, card stock or other specialty media using the single-sheet versatile bypass tray. 100-sheet paper capacity accommodating up to legal (8.5 x 14) sized paper Plus up to 20-sheet auto document feeder for unattended copy, scan and fax. The country of Origin is Philippines. Design that delivers high availability, scalability, and for maximum flexibility and price/performance.
feature_bullets: Design that delivers High availability, scalability, and for maximum flexibility and price/performance
The country of Origin is Philippines

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars70 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
